intro: Tauschia hooveri, commonly known as the Hoover's tauschia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry, hot environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Tauschia hooveri is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
